result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.dispoDesc: To be used as a read-in on case 2015CF2397

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Wardel Burks

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Attorney Michael Jude in court, defendant Wardel Burks not in court, in custody.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Restitution hearing conducted.  Court sets restitution in the amount of $0.

Defendant Wardel Burks in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Defendant Wardel Burks in custody.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Pursuant to plea negotations, and on motion of the State, Court ordered case DISMISSED to be used as a read-in on 15CF2397.  However, there may be restitution owed on this case.  This matter set over  for a status to see if victim is requesting restitution and if so, a restitution hearing will be scheduled.  Status conference scheduled for August 28, 2015 at 08:15 am.
Branch 21 will accept this case to be a part of  global resolution with case #15CF2397. Cases are set for plea and sentencing before Judge Brash in Branch 21 on 07/30/15 at 1:30.

Attorney Michael Jude in court, defendant Wardel Burks not in court, in custody and not produced. Defendant's appearance waived for today's proceedings.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Case calendared for projected guilty plea and sentencing. Defense counsel states defendant has pending felony #15CF2397, additional time needed to review for global resolution.   Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 37.  Status conference scheduled for July 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.

15RM025992  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
05-23-15

Attorney Michael Jude in court, defendant Wardel Burks not in court, in custody, not produced.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
   Defense counsel has received discovery and offer.  Any and all motions are to be filed with the court by the final pretrial date.    Case is adjourned for projected plea and sentencing in Branch 37.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 4, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant has trouble hearing, Court ordered a listening device be available for the next court date.  Interpreter Coordinator to be contacted for listening device.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with T.R.
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Wardel Burks in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Defendant Wardel Burks in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
